articles.title: Decree of DPRK SPA Presidium Issued
articles.content:
Decree of DPRK SPA Presidium Issued
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly issued a decree on setting up the Ministry of Foodstuff and Daily Necessities Industry on July 22.

articles.title: Cuban Embassy Staffers Help Korean Workers
articles.content:
Cuban Embassy Staffers Help Korean Workers
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Enrique Montoto Cruz, charge d' affaires a.i., and staff members of the Cuban embassy here gave a helping hand to the DPRK-Cuba friendship factory on July 22 on the occasion of the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 The guests were briefed on the history of the factory in front of the monument to on-site teachings and instructions of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They helped the employees of the factory in cutting grass. 
					
					 During a break, they talked with officials of the factory, deepening friendship.

articles.title: DPRK Students Win Gold Medals in Intl' Mathematic Olympiad
articles.content:
DPRK Students Win Gold Medals in Intl' Mathematic Olympiad
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Students of the DPRK proved successful in the 50th International Mathematic Olympiad held in Germany from July 14 to 21.
					 Participants competed in the theory of numbers, algebra, geometry and combination. 
					
					 Ri Un Song, Kim Jong Chol and Ri Yong Hyon bagged gold medals by successfully solving those questions requiring a high level of concentration and thinking power.
					
					 Meanwhile, Son Hae Chol and Choe Jang Su won silver medals and Jon Ho Gon a bronze medal.

articles.title: Susan-ri Condemns U.S. Imperialists' Massacre
articles.content:
Susan-ri Condemns U.S. Imperialists' Massacre
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- A stream of servicemen, working people and school youth and children of the DPRK are visiting the House of Class Education in Susan-ri, Kangso County, South Phyongan Province every day.
					The house of class education which was opened in May Juche 93 (2004) is a place exposing to the whole world the genocide committed by the U.S. imperialists  at a time of the temporary strategic retreat of the Korean People's Army during the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					The U.S. aggressors occupied Kangso County on October 20, 1950 and organized reactionary organizations such as the "Kangso County peace maintenance corps", "Kangso County police force" and "anti-communist national salvation society" with reactionaries who had hidden themselves and forced them to slay people.
					
					 While occupying the county for 46 days, the U.S. imperialists perpetrated unheard-of murderous atrocities of killing more than 11,600 people, drenching the area with blood. In particular, they slaughtered at least 1,050 inhabitants, or one third of the population of the then Susan-myon in the most cold-blooded way.
					
					 Relics disclosing the horrible atrocities committed by the enemies in the Susan-ri area are being discovered one after another.
					
					 Hundreds of thousands of people have visited the house since its opening.

articles.title: Man-made Lake Yonphung
articles.content:
Man-made Lake Yonphung
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Lake Yonphung is one of typical man-made lakes in Korea.
					 The lake is irrigating a large acreage of croplands in the areas of Anju, Mundok, Sukchon and Phyongwon of South Phyongan Province.
					
					 The lake, completed in Juche 45 (1956), has the River Taedong and atmospheric precipitation as its main source.
					
					 It teems with various kinds of freshwater fishes including carp and goldfish.
					
					 A children's camp, rest home and sanatoria are situated on the picturesque lakefront.
					
					 The lake is associated with the glorious revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il who visited it on several occasions including May 1956 and June 1964.
					
					 The President named it Lake Yonphung.
					
					 There stands the Monument to the History of the Phyongnam Irrigation on the shore of the lake to convey long the immortal feats of the President.

articles.title: KCNA Terms Story of "Chain Reaction" Hypocritical
articles.content:
KCNA Terms Story of "Chain Reaction" Hypocritical
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is now spreading in the countries around the DPRK the rumor that "chain reaction" may occur in Japan and south Korea unless the DPRK's access to nukes is checked.
					The rumor has it that the DPRK's access to nukes may prompt Japan and south Korea to go nuclear, fearful of its "threat".
					
					It sounds plausible at first but one can easily guess this is a sheer speculation as it is a departure from a reality.
					
					Humankind wishes to see a nuclear-free world.
					
					Had countries vied with each other to have access to nukes because of nuclear threat there might have already appeared a great number of nuclear weapons states in the world.
					
					When a country is exposed to very potential and serious nuclear threats and when it finds no other way to cope with them, it is compelled to have access to nukes as its last resort.
					
					Japan and south Korea have long been under the U.S. "nuclear umbrella".
					
					The U.S.-touted "nuclear umbrella" means giving its ally assurances that it will retaliate against other country's nuclear attack with nukes. This umbrella also means an institutional mechanism for putting them into practice.
					
					It was after China's first nuclear test in 1964 that Japan was definitely put under the U.S. "nuclear umbrella".
					
					At that time Japan claimed that China's access to nukes posed "threat" to it just as it is blaming the DPRK at present. This resulted in bolstering up the U.S. "nuclear umbrella" for Japan.
					
					In the 1970s south Korea pursued a clandestine nuclear weapons development program only to be uncovered and curbed by its U.S. master. This helped south Korea to come under a more reliable U.S. "nuclear umbrella" in return for its abandoning of the nuclear development.
					
					No one will believe the claims of Japan and south Korea that they are exposed to "nuclear threat" as they are under the "nuclear umbrella" of the U.S. which tops the world's list of nuclear weapons.
					
					Moreover, the U.S. forces are present in Japan and south Korea on a permanent basis and the U.S. warships and airplanes equipped with nuclear weapons regularly visit Japan and south Korea to conduct ceaseless nuclear war exercises.
					
					As seen above, one may safely say that both Japan and south Korea are practically armed with nuclear weapons. 
					
					But quite different is the case with the DPRK.
					
					The DPRK has never been provided with any nuclear umbrella by outsiders to cope with the U.S. nuclear threat.
					
					There was the "DPRK-USSR treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance" in the period of the Soviet Union. But the USSR made no promise to protect the DPRK with its nuclear weapons in case the U.S. attacks the DPRK with nuclear weapons.
					
					Worse still, the treaty came to an end with the collapse of the Soviet Union. And there is no legal obligation between the DPRK and Russia at present to render mutual assistance in case of emergency. 
					
					As far as the treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance between the DPRK and China is concerned, it was concluded when China was a non-nuclear state. It is, therefore, quite irrelevant to the provision of "nuclear umbrella."
					
					It is our view that China has pursued the policy of keeping "minimum nuclear deterrent" for protecting itself only.
					
					In fact, China's existing nuclear armed forces are not big enough to protect other countries and they do not stand comparison with the nuclear armed forces of the U.S. threatening the DPRK, in particular. This is a well known fact.
					
					It was only the DPRK that was left unprotected by nukes when south Korea and its neighboring countries were equipped with nuclear weapons or provided with nuclear umbrella.
					
					Only danger of war will increase when one of the two hostile parties is armed with nuclear weapons or protected by a "nuclear umbrella" while the other remains defenseless, having none of them.
					
					The DPRK's access to nukes helped keep a nuclear balance in Northeast Asia even in the least, thus making it possible to deter a war.
					
					Some individual right-wing elements in Japan are crying out for going nuclear but this is not prompted by their worry about any threat. 
					
					What they seek is to go nuclear with the DPRK's access to nukes as a pretext and thus call back the departed soul of the militarists who attacked Pearl Harbor and worked hard to realize the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere." This is a reality of this region.
					
					The arithmetic logic that Japan and south Korea may go nuclear because the DPRK has had access to nukes is an expression of ignorance of those who are bereft of an elementary sense. This is only part of a clumsy psychological warfare launched against the DPRK's access to nukes.

articles.title: Japan's Extremely Hostile Policy towards DPRK Assailed
articles.content:
Japan's Extremely Hostile Policy towards DPRK Assailed
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The Japanese authorities called a Cabinet meeting at the prime minister's residence on July 6. At this meeting they decided to take "preventive measures on the transfer of property to be helpful to the planning and activities to cope with nukes and ballistic missiles" of the DPRK and "its other WMDs" and notified all the ministries and agencies of it. On July 7 they adopted a "bill on special inspection of cargo" which legally allows the inspection of cargo of the DPRK-flagged ships and those of other countries sailing to the DPRK and submitted it to the House of Representatives.
					On June 18 Japan began suspending the sending of all mail to the DPRK by organs of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan at all levels, Koreans in Japan and organizations friendly toward the DPRK as a part of the additional sanctions towards the latter.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					This action taken by the Japanese reactionaries is a revelation of the extremely hostile acts against the DPRK which can be perpetrated only by those who are steeped in bitterness towards it to the marrow of their bones and a hideous human rights abuse, the commentary notes, and goes on;
					
					The present situation eloquently proves that the Japanese reactionaries' hostile policy towards the DPRK and Chongryon has gone beyond the tolerance limit. 
					
					Japan's recent measure, an escalation of its hostile policy towards the DPRK, is the most despicable and vicious one aimed at stifling and isolating the latter, binding Chongryon and Koreans in Japan hand and foot and severing their ties with the homeland. This action has put the hostile relations between the DPRK and Japan beyond the danger line.
					
					If Japan dares escalate the sanctions against the DPRK and Chongryon, it will have to pay dearly for it. This is a warning to the Japanese reactionaries going reckless, seized by the anti-DPRK hysteria.
					
					Japan had better stop the noisy racket of sanctions against the DPRK, bearing in mind that "sanctions" are bound to be entailed by retaliation, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: Japan's Scheme to Modernize Armed Forces Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Scheme to Modernize Armed Forces Blasted
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Japan is scheming to independently develop the fighter plane of new generation, an imitation of the U.S. F-22, in several years. This is intended to round off Japan's capability for surprise preemptive attack on other countries and provide military guarantee for overseas expansion.
					Minju Joson says this in a signed commentary today.
					
					Overseas aggression is the invariable ambition and strategic goal of the Japanese reactionaries, the commentary points out, and goes on to say:
					
					To this end, they have been rushing headlong toward the conversion of Japan into a military giant and overseas aggression, throwing off its mask of "pacifist state" and openly revealing its militaristic nature.
					
					They are nowadays pushing ahead with the scheme to introduce the new missile defense system over "threat" from someone. And they are busy with the introduction of refueling tankers, the development of early warning satellite and launch of information-gathering satellite while underlining the need to approve the exercise of the right to collective self-defence, reexamine the "three principles of arms export" and possess "capability for attacking the enemies' bases." The facts go to clearly prove that Japan is making every possible effort to emerge a military power.
					
					Such reckless moves are arousing apprehension and wariness from among the world people desirous of peace.
					
					The Japanese reactionaries should immediately stop the risky moves to turn Japan into a military power, pondering over what terrible catastrophe their reckless and madcap reinvasion scheme to carry into reality the old dream for the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" which Japan failed to do so in the past, will bring.

articles.title: "Pragmatic" Dictatorship of Lee Myung Bak Slammed
articles.content:
"Pragmatic" Dictatorship of Lee Myung Bak Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The "pragmatic" dictatorship pursued by traitor Lee Myung Bak in south Korea is the source of bringing only disasters and misfortunes to the nation. Without removing this source, it is impossible to realize independence, democracy and national reunification desired so ardently by the south Korean people.
					 Rodong Sinmun today observes this in a signed article.
					
					 Terming the "pragmatic" dictatorship the worst unpopular, fascist and treacherous politics that serves to block the independent development and stifle the human rights and democracy in south Korean society and invite confrontation between the fellow countrymen and a disaster of nuclear war in disregard of the entire nation's will for peace and reunification, the article says:
					
					 The dictatorship of the Lee regime is, in fact, no more than a tool for tightening the U.S. domination over south Korea.
					
					 As the hideous colonial fascist politics forcing the south Koreans to submit to foreign forces, the dictatorship has become a hotbed of all sorts of disgrace and misfortunes.
					
					 The Lee group regards all those aspiring after social progress and justice and independence and reunification of the nation as target of violent suppression.
					
					 It is kicking up a frantic campaign of fascist repression, reminiscent of a witch-hunt in the medieval age, while intensively fanning up the outdated "theory of principal enemy" and war hysteria for invasion of the DPRK by mobilizing all the puppet military and fascist power bodies, plot-breeding tools and reptile media.
					
					 The prevailing situation urgently calls for putting an immediate end to the "pragmatic" dictatorship, pro-American sycophantic, fascist and anti-reunification politics, in south Korea.

articles.title: Mammoth Protest Rally of Workers Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Mammoth Protest Rally of Workers Held in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- At least 10,000 members of the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea held a rally in Seoul on July 18 in protest against unpopular labor policies of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors, according to south Korean MBC. 
					 Participants in the rally denounced the Lee Myung Bak regime for unilaterally pursuing such unjust labor policies as privatization of public enterprises and manpower reduction, etc. despite the protest of the workers.
					
					 They demanded the authorities put an end to the misrule aimed at imposing sacrifices on the workers only and immediately stop the reckless discharge of part-time workers.

articles.title: Representative of Democratic Party of S. Korea Enters into Sit-in Hunger Strike
articles.content:
Representative of Democratic Party of S. Korea Enters into Sit-in Hunger Strike
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Jong Se Gyun, representative of the Democratic Party of south Korea, entered into a sit-in hunger strike on July 19 to prevent the Grand National Party of south Korea from railroading the "bill on media" through the "National Assembly", according to south Korean MBC. 
					He declared he would do everything to hold in check the tyrannical action of the ruling party to transfer the right to manage the broadcasting services to big businesses despite the people's protest.

articles.title: Campaign to Judge Lee Group Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Campaign to Judge Lee Group Launched in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- More than 20,000 people including opposition party members and members of the Teachers' Union and other civic and public organizations of south Korea held the second "all-people rally" for judging the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in Seoul on July 19.
					Speakers at the rally declared: People from all walks of life keep waging the movement for issuing declarations on the situation to demand the authorities roll back their unpopular policies in various parts of south Korea in the wake of the first "all-people rally" held on June 10. However, Lee Myung Bak has intensified his repressive rule, far from seeking to reach "understanding with the people." 
					
					They called upon all the progressive and patriotic forces to unite and form a front of the anti-Lee Myung Bak struggle and turn out as one in the struggle to eliminate the Lee Myung Bak conservative ruling forces, improve the people's livelihood, restore democracy and preserve peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					At the end of the rally the participants staged a candlelight march to the place where the Ryongsan tragedy took place.

articles.title: South Korean Authorities' Suppression of Teachers Slammed
articles.content:
South Korean Authorities' Suppression of Teachers Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The Teachers' Union of south Korea (Jongyojo) issued the second declaration on the situation on July 19. It was signed by at least 28,600 teachers throughout it.
					 The declaration accused the authorities of becoming ever more undisguised in cracking down upon those who participated in the first campaign to issue a declaration on the situation, branding this as a blatant abuse of power.
					
					 It urged the Lee Myung Bak regime to roll back the unjust educational policy which only advocates "competition is all powerful" and lift the measures to punish the participants of the above-said campaign as early as possible.
					
					 The chairman of Jongyojo said: Teachers are thrown behind bars, their houses searched and punished for the mere reason that they urged the authorities to lend an ear to the voices of people. Even under this situation they have waged an indomitable struggle and signed the declaration on the situation for the democratization of the society.
					
					 Neither dictatorship nor suppression by the authorities can overpower the people united close as one, he declared.

articles.title: Press Trade Union Calls General Strike in S. Korea
articles.content:
Press Trade Union Calls General Strike in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Press Trade Union went on a general strike on July 21 in protest against the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors' scheme to railroad the evil bill on media.
					Involved in the general strike were trade unions of MBC, SBS and other broadcasting services and broadcasting services and newspapers in some regions.
					
					Earlier on July 20, the Press Trade Union called a press conference outside the "Grand National Party" building to declare the general strike.
					
					The organization charged that Lee Myung Bak and the ruling party are working hard to blindfold and deafen the people by putting the media under their control, not content with pursuing the policy only for the privileged circle.
					
					 The "bill on media" the GNP is seeking to railroad is an unpopular as it is intended to build up public opinion favorable exclusively for the regime and capital by allowing the big businesses and the specific conservative newspapers to have the right to manage broadcasting services, it pointed out.
					
					It stressed that the general strike is a fight to get the evil bill on media, cooked up by the GNP, totally repealed.
					
					If the "government" and the ruling party finally railroad the said bill in disregard of the population's will, they will face a stern punishment by the people, the organization warned.

articles.title: President Kim Il Sung Praised in Various Countries
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung Praised in Various Countries
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings, seminars, a lecture and film shows took place in Bangladesh, France, Germany and Singapore between June 25 and July 7 to commemorate the 15th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, said at a remembrance meeting that Kim Il Sung was a prominent leader recognized by the whole world. The President's revolutionary cause has been successfully carried forward and developed under the Songun leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he noted.
					
					Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, in the lecture praised Kim Il Sung as the great leader who founded the immortal Juche idea and guided the Korean revolution to victory. The progressive humankind will always remember the feats performed by him for global socialism and independence against imperialism, he said.
					
					Guy Dupre, vice-president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, said at a remembrance meeting that Kim Il Sung was the greatest man with immeasurably noble virtues and personality.
					
					Jean Marie Lambret, chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, said at a seminar that it is Kim Il Sung who provided the historical roots of the Songun politics and that his immortal feats will remain long with the century.
					
					Korean films including "For the Liberation of the Country" were shown at the film shows.
					
					A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar held in France.

articles.title: S. Korean Ruling Forces' Separatist Moves Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Ruling Forces' Separatist Moves Flayed
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association and the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on July 13 denouncing the south Korean authorities for their politically-motivated crackdown upon the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon). 
					The statement referred to the fact that political campaign against the pro-reunification patriotic forces and personages is now going on in south Korea. It disclosed that traitor Lee Myung Bak recently had the puppet prosecution announce "results of investigation into the cases of violation of the 'National Security Law'" and detain the chairman and two other leading members of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon.
					
					Such fascist repression goes to clearly prove that the south Korean authorities do not want Korea's reunification but are engaging themselves in all sorts of machinations to escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula and stamp out the reunification movement, it pointed out.
					
					The statement said that the said association and group resolutely condemn the south Korean ruling forces for their moves to hinder national reunification and exterminate the democratic organizations of south Korea struggling for cooperation and prosperity between the north and the south.
					
					It urged the south Korean authorities to put an immediate halt to the political suppression of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and ensure free and democratic political activities of all the forces of south Korea struggling for reunification and democracy.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Saved Child at Risk of Her Life
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Saved Child at Risk of Her Life
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- One day in mid-October of Juche 23 (1934), Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, was harvesting crops together with people of a village.
					Enemy soldiers surprised the village, sending people rushing for cover.
					
					Then a woman burst into tears, saying that she had run only with a sorghum-sheaf on her head, leaving her five-year-old child sleeping at the edge of the field. She was going to turn back.
					
					But Kim Jong Suk made no scruple of hurrying to the field the enemy soldiers were approaching.
					
					There were only the rattles of shots and she was not seen.
					
					After a long while, people caught a glimpse of her running with the child on her back in the opposite woods.
					
					After a while, the shot ceased and a pillar of flames shot up on the field.
					
					Villagers, with bated breath, quartered calling her name.
					
					Wet with sweat, she returned, making a way through the thick woods with the child on her back.
					
					All the people, to say nothing of the woman who took her child saved in the jaws of death, were deeply moved by the self-sacrificing spirit of Kim Jong Suk.

articles.title: Coreanos obtienen medallas de oro en Olimpiada Internacional
articles.content:
Coreanos obtienen medallas de oro en Olimpiada Internacional
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- Los alumnos coreanos lograron los exitos excelentes en la 50a Olimpiada Internacional de Matematica efectuada del dia 14 al 21 en Alemania.
					En la presente olimpiada se presentaron los problemas matematicos de las ramas de la teoria del numero, el algebra, la geometria y la combinacion.
					
					Ri Un Song, Kim Jong Chol y Ri Yong Hyon obtuvieron las medallas de oro al resolver satisfactoriamente los problemas de alto nivel que demandan la alta capacidad concentrada?y la facultad de pensar.
					
					Por otra parte, Son Hae Chol y Choe Jang Su recibieron las medallas de plata y Jon Ho Gon, la de bronce, respectivamente.

articles.title: ATCC comenta teoria de "reaccion en cadena" sobre armas nucleares
articles.content:
ATCC comenta teoria de "reaccion en cadena" sobre armas nucleares
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- En estos tiempos, Estados Unidos difunde a los paises circunvecinos el rumor de que se originaria una "reaccion en cadena" en Japon y el Sur de Corea si no se logra impedir la posesion de armas nucleares de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					 Es decir, si la RPDC tiene las armas nucleares, Japon y el Sur de Corea se sentiran "amenazados" y optaran por armarse con las mismas.
					
					 Aunque parece razonable prima facie, esta logica no pasa de ser una hipotesis absurda y no pegada a la realidad.
					
					 La humanidad aspira a un mundo desnuclearizado.
					
					 Si los paises hubieran competido en poseer las armas nucleares por ser amenazados por ellas, este mundo se habria repletado ya de los paises provistos de ellas.
					
					 El arma nuclear es el medio que adquiere por ultimo e inevitablemente un pais cuando no le queda otro remedio para hacer frente a la amenaza nuclear a que es sometido practica y gravemente.
					
					 Pero, Japon y el Sur de Corea son protegidos desde mucho antes por el "paraguas nuclear" de EE.UU.
					
					 Este paraguas consiste en la promesa de EE.UU. de tomar la represalia con armas nucleares norteamericanas si un pais aliado fuera victima de ataque nuclear y en el aparato institucional para cumplirla.
					
					 Japon se guarecio mas bajo el "paraguas nuclear" del imperio desde 1964 cuando China realizo la primera prueba nuclear.
					
					 Entonces, Japon refunfunaba que la tenencia de arma nuclear de China le representaba una "amenaza", como lo esta haciendo ahora con la RPDC, y por consiguiente, EE.UU. dio la "proteccion nuclear" mas solida al primero.
					
					 Sucedio lo mismo en el caso del Sur de Corea.
					
					El Sur de Corea tuvo que abortar el desarrollo de arma nuclear, que impulsaba en la decada de 1970 sin que lo supiera su amo gringo, cuando este se dio cuenta de esto y le ofrecio el "paraguas nuclear" mas solido a condicion de que renuncie a ese proyecto.
					
					Nadie creera a Japon y el Sur de Corea, que son protegidos por EE.UU. que cuenta con el arsenal nuclear mas grande del mundo, por mucho que ellos insistan en que son "amenazados" con armas nucleares.
					
					Ademas, en ambos paises estan acampadas permanentemente las tropas norteamericanas y vienen y van regularmente los buques de guerra y los aviones norteamericanos con armas nucleares a bordo para ejercitar la guerra nuclear.
					
					Se puede decir que Japon y el Sur de Corea estan repletos de armas nucleares porque son protegidos por EE.UU. con las mismas y tienen en sus territorios un gran numero de efectivos norteamericanos.
					
					Pero, el caso de la RPDC es diametralmente diferente.
					
					La RPDC nunca ha tenido un paraguas nuclear extranjero que la protegiera de la amenaza nuclear de EE.UU.
					
					Si bien en el periodo de la ex URSS existia el "Tratado de amistad, cooperacion y ayuda mutua RPDC-URSS", no hubo la promesa de que esta nacion euroasiatica iba a vengarse de EE.UU. cuando Corea fuera atacada por armas nucleares de este imperio.
					
					Para colmo, ese tratado dejo de existir junto con el derrumbe de la Union Sovietica y actualmente entre la RPDC y Rusia no hay ningun compromiso legal sobre la ayuda mutua en el tiempo de emergencia.
					
					El tratado de igual indole entre Corea y China es mucho mas desvinculado al suministro de "paraguas nuclear" porque fue firmado cuando China era un Estado sin armas nucleares.
					
					Ademas, se cree que China tiene la politica de mantener el "minimo disuasivo nuclear" para proteger solo su territorio nacional.
					
					Realmente, las actuales fuerzas nucleares de China no alcanzan para defender a otros paises y son incomparablemente debiles que las de EE.UU. que amenazan a la RPDC.
					
					En fin, la RPDC se quedaba como la unica parte sin armas nucleares en la Peninsula Coreana y su zona periferica cubiertas de esas armas y el paraguas nuclear.
					
					En las relaciones entre las dos partes en antagonismo, si una parte tiene armas nucleares o se halla bajo "el paraguas nuclear" y la otra se encuentra indefensa sin ninguna de las dos cosas, creceria solo el peligro de guerra.
					
					Cuando la RPDC dispuso de su propia arma nuclear, se establecio, aunque en lo basico, el equilibro entre las fuerzas nucleares en el Nordeste Asiatico y por resultado, se hizo posible disuadir mas la guerra.
					
					Ahora algunos elementos derechistas de Japon abogan por el armamento nuclear no porque estan preocupados.
					
					Esta insistencia es el disparate del fantasma militarista que trata de escenificar de nuevo el ataque a Pearl Harbor y establecer la "esfera de co-prosperidad de la gran Asia oriental" al emprender el camino de armamento nuclear aprovechando y pretextando la tenencia de armas nucleares por parte de la RPDC.
					
					Esto es la realidad de la region.
					
					La logica de la primaria, de que la posesion de armas nucleares de la RPDC causara el efecto domino en Japon y el Sur de Corea, es la expresion de la ignorancia que proviene de la carencia de la basica sensibilidad a la realidad o el colofon del complot psicologico mal ideado para calumniar la tenencia de esos artefactos de la RPDC.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica maniobras hostiles anti-RPDC de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica maniobras hostiles anti-RPDC de Japon
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- En la reunion  ministerial efectuada el dia 6 en la residencia oficial del premier, las autoridades japonesas aprobaron las "medidas preventivas al traslado de los bienes para contribuir a los planes y actividades referentes a armas nucleares y misiles balisticos o las armas de exterminio masivo de Corea" y las anunciaron a todos los ministerios y las agencias.
					Ademas, el dia 7 decidieron el "proyecto de ley de medidas especiales sobre el control de cargas" que permite legalmente inspeccionar las cargas de los barcos de la RPDC y otros extranjeros que viajen por esta,  lo presento ante la Camara de Representantes.
					
					Con anterioridad, desde el 18 de junio interceptaron como un eslabon de las sanciones adicionales los correos que envian los organos a todos los niveles de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon), los compatriotas residentes en Japon y las entidades procoreanas  a la RPDC.
					
					Tal medida es muestra de las maniobras hostiles a la RPDC y el crimen de violacion a los derechos humanos que pueden cometer solo los arraigados de la conciencia de hostilidad a Corea.
					
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este miercoles y prosigue:
					
					La situacion actual evidencia elocuentemente que llega al punto limite la politica de hostilidad de los reaccionarios japoneses a la RPDC y la Chongryon. 
					
					La presente sancion de Japon deviene la ampliacion escalonada de la politica hostil a Corea y vil acto tendente a asfixiar y aislar a la RPDC, atar de pies y manos a la Chongryon y los coreanos residentes en Japon y romperles los lazos con la patria. 
					
					Debido a tales maniobras, las relaciones hostiles Corea-Japon llegan al extremo del peligro.  
					
					Advertimos a los reaccionarios japoneses que actuan con imprudencia contra la RPDC. 
					
					Japon pagara caro si blande atrevidamente el "garrote" de sancion a la RPDC y la Chongryon.
					
					Debe tener presente que la "sancion" traera la venganza y renunciar tal alboroto de sancion anti-RPDC.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia modernizacion de fuerzas armadas de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia modernizacion de fuerzas armadas de Japon
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- Japon planea ahora desarrollar independientemente en unos anos el avion de combate de nueva generacion imitando el caza ultramoderno Stealth "F-22" de Estados Unidos.
					Esto parte de su objetivo de completar la capacidad de ataque sorpresivo y preventivo a otros paises y dar la garantia militar del expansionismo a ultramar, asi revela el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este miercoles y continua:
					
					La agresion a ultramar es la invariable ambicion y meta estrategica de los reaccionarios japoneses. 
					
					Para este fin, marchan a galopes por la senda a la potencia militar y la agresion a ultramar exponiendo abiertamente su naturaleza militarista y quitandose  la mascara de "Estado pacifista".
					
					Por ejemplo, ultimamente, ellos impulsan activamente la implantacion del nuevo sistema antimisiles bajo el pretexto de la "amenaza" de alguien.
					
					Asimismo, andan ajetreados por introducir el avion nodriza, desarrollar el satelite de alerta previa y lanzar el otro de espionaje abogando por el ejercicio del "derecho a la autodefensa colectiva", la revision de los "3 principios de exportacion de armas" y la "posesion de la capacidad de ataque a las bases enemigas".
					
					Este imprudente movimiento de los reaccionarios japoneses provoca la preocupacion y la vigilancia de los pueblos pacifistas del mundo.
					
					Ellos deben parar ahora mismo sus aventureras acciones para convertir a su pais en una potencia militar al meditar en las catastroficas consecuencias de la nueva agresion que quieren lanzar para llevar a la realidad su rancio sueno de la "esfera de co-prosperidad de la gran Asia oriental", que no pudieron establecer en el siglo pasado.
